newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil to repay $830 million to Paris Club nations.
newsitem.headline: Brazil to repay $830 million to Paris Club nations.

text.p: Brazil is set to pay $830 million in principal and interest to the Paris Club of creditor nations between December 30 and January 6, the Central Bank said.
Of the total, $479.2 million was in principal with the remainding $350.8 million in interest, the bank said in a statement.

Brazil will pay $191 million to Germany, $179 million to France, $175 million to Japan with the remainder being split up among ten other countries. The operations are part of the third and fourth stages of Brazil's Paris Club debt repayments.
